result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample by 10/19/22 and pay the surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including the DNA surcharge at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning 12/1/22 until paid in full.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheronda Denise McCorkle

records.addlTxt: Return of property hearing on November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Sheronda Denise McCorkle.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 2 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Submit a DNA sample by 10/19/22 and pay the surcharge.

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning 12/01/22, until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Sheronda Denise McCorkle.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. OFF THE RECORD.
Case set for a plea and sentencing. Court is in trial and can not hear the matter. Case is adjourned to Branch 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Sam Obscherning appears in Court with defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle. Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed but not acted upon. Judge Conen (Branch 13) spun plea/sentencing hearing to Judge Davila (Branch 1) which accepted.

Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court with attorney Michael Fuentes for Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD Obscherning is unable to pass the Milwaukee County health protocol screening.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pretrial. Defense counsel informed the Court this case is in resolution posture and requests a plea/sentencing date. Jury trial remains calendared in Branch 37.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. 
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: MK.   Case in court for status conference.  Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: MK.

Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sheronda Denise McCorkle appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sheronda Denise McCorkle appeared by video means with Attorney.    
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sheronda Denise McCorkle in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sheronda Denise McCorkle
Current: 4655 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 02-24-2022)
Prior: 4755 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/24/22 @ 2p
